      • getHalfLifeSeconds

        public long getHalfLifeSeconds()
        The amount of time mission control will take to restore a penalized node
or channel back to 50% success probability, expressed in seconds. Setting
this value to a higher value will penalize failures for longer, making
mission control less likely to route through nodes and channels that we
have previously recorded failures for.
        uint64 half_life_seconds = 1;
        Specified by:
        getHalfLifeSeconds in interface RouterOuterClass.MissionControlConfigOrBuilder

      • setHalfLifeSeconds

        public RouterOuterClass.MissionControlConfig.Builder setHalfLifeSeconds​(long value)
        The amount of time mission control will take to restore a penalized node
or channel back to 50% success probability, expressed in seconds. Setting
this value to a higher value will penalize failures for longer, making
mission control less likely to route through nodes and channels that we
have previously recorded failures for.
        uint64 half_life_seconds = 1;

      • clearHalfLifeSeconds

        public RouterOuterClass.MissionControlConfig.Builder clearHalfLifeSeconds()
        The amount of time mission control will take to restore a penalized node
or channel back to 50% success probability, expressed in seconds. Setting
this value to a higher value will penalize failures for longer, making
mission control less likely to route through nodes and channels that we
have previously recorded failures for.
        uint64 half_life_seconds = 1;

      • getHopProbability

        public float getHopProbability()
        The probability of success mission control should assign to hop in a route
where it has no other information available. Higher values will make mission
control more willing to try hops that we have no information about, lower
values will discourage trying these hops.
        float hop_probability = 2;
        Specified by:
        getHopProbability in interface RouterOuterClass.MissionControlConfigOrBuilder

      • setHopProbability

        public RouterOuterClass.MissionControlConfig.Builder setHopProbability​(float value)
        The probability of success mission control should assign to hop in a route
where it has no other information available. Higher values will make mission
control more willing to try hops that we have no information about, lower
values will discourage trying these hops.
        float hop_probability = 2;

      • clearHopProbability

        public RouterOuterClass.MissionControlConfig.Builder clearHopProbability()
        The probability of success mission control should assign to hop in a route
where it has no other information available. Higher values will make mission
control more willing to try hops that we have no information about, lower
values will discourage trying these hops.
        float hop_probability = 2;

      • getWeight

        public float getWeight()
        The importance that mission control should place on historical results,
expressed as a value in [0;1]. Setting this value to 1 will ignore all
historical payments and just use the hop probability to assess the
probability of success for each hop. A zero value ignores hop probability
completely and relies entirely on historical results, unless none are
available.
        float weight = 3;
        Specified by:
        getWeight in interface RouterOuterClass.MissionControlConfigOrBuilder

      • setWeight

        public RouterOuterClass.MissionControlConfig.Builder setWeight​(float value)
        The importance that mission control should place on historical results,
expressed as a value in [0;1]. Setting this value to 1 will ignore all
historical payments and just use the hop probability to assess the
probability of success for each hop. A zero value ignores hop probability
completely and relies entirely on historical results, unless none are
available.
        float weight = 3;

      • clearWeight

        public RouterOuterClass.MissionControlConfig.Builder clearWeight()
        The importance that mission control should place on historical results,
expressed as a value in [0;1]. Setting this value to 1 will ignore all
historical payments and just use the hop probability to assess the
probability of success for each hop. A zero value ignores hop probability
completely and relies entirely on historical results, unless none are
available.
        float weight = 3;
